intro: Byrsonima cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipo tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and local herbal practices.
